Classes¶

class landmark_config.LandmarkRecognitionConfiguration[source]¶

Class provide loading of config file (config/config.ini)

get_canny_binary_low()[source]¶

Load canny limits for low range

Returns:Config value
get_canny_binary_lower()[source]¶

Load canny limits for lower range

Returns:Config value
get_canny_binary_medium()[source]¶

Load canny limits for medium range

Returns:Config value
get_canny_binary_up()[source]¶

Load canny limits for up range

Returns:Config value
get_canny_binary_upper()[source]¶

Load canny limits for upper range

Returns:Config value
get_find_mode()[source]¶

This parameter set will script search all landmarks for current frame by processing all founded contours. Or skip all if first was found

Returns:Config value
Return type:Boolean
get_frame_size()[source]¶

Return frame size to display image example in test mode

Returns:Config value
get_log_mode()[source]¶

Logging of any messages of script: warnings and errors

Returns:Config value
get_mode()[source]¶

Return mode for image processing. This parameter using for select optimal values of canny operator for binarization image

Returns:Config value
get_work_mode()[source]¶

This configuration control work mode of script: ACTIVE - script give current coordinates and mark type to another process PASSIVE - script give current coordinates and mark type to another process by request

Returns:Config value
class landmark_frame.LandmarkFrame(config)[source]¶

This class process source grayscale image and give thre binary images for processing corresponding mode paramenter

class marktypes.contour_processor.ContourProcessor[source]¶

This class provide methods for recognizing landmarks in image

calculateDistance(radius)[source]¶

Calculate distance from the camera to landmark bounding by circle

Warning

Method is incomplete

Parameters:radius – radius of landmark
Returns:distance from camera to landmark
checkAvg(avg, accept_percentage)[source]¶

Returns true if the average value of pixels more than the accept_percentage

Parameters:
  • avg – a average values given by getLineAvgColor().
  • accept_percentage – value in percent when average color will accent as allowable
Returns:

True - if average higher than given percentage, False - otherwise
createLineIterator(point1, point2, img, binary=False)[source]¶

Produces and array that consists of the coordinates and intensities of each pixel in a line between two points

Parameters:
  • point1 – a numpy array that consists of the coordinate of the first point (x,y)
  • point2 – a numpy array that consists of the coordinate of the second point (x,y)
  • img – the image being processed
Returns:

a numpy array that consists of the coordinates and intensities of each pixel in the radii (shape: [numPixels, 3], row = [x,y,intensity])
distance(point1, point2)[source]¶

Function calculates distance between two points.

Parameters:
  • point1 – coordinate of the first point (x,y)
  • point2 – coordinate of the second point (x,y)
Returns:

distance
drawMark(img, points, shift)[source]¶

Draw landmark lines in image

Warning

Function must be overridden in child classes

Parameters:
  • img – image fot drawing
  • points – points of mark
  • shift –
Returns:

None
getLineAvgColor(iterator, binary=False)[source]¶

Compute average value of color in array of pixels given by createLineIterator

Parameters:iterator – a numpy array given by createLineIterator().
Returns:average color value [0-255]
isInCircleInside(contour, center, radius)[source]¶

Returns true if the all point of contour inside of the circle

Parameters:
  • contour – contoir for check
  • center – center of circle
  • radius – radius of circle
Returns:

True - if all point of contour inside if circle. False - otherwise
middlePoint(point1, point2, ratio=1)[source]¶

Function returns coordinates of point in line which pass throught point1 and point2. And point divides the line in a predetermined ratio Source code was given there: http://stackoverflow.com/a/32857432/5623063

Parameters:
  • point1 – coordinate of the first point (x,y)
  • point2 – coordinate of the second point (x,y)
  • ratio – ratio of deviding
Returns:

point coordinates
rgbToGray(color)[source]¶

Convert RGB color to grayscale

Parameters:color – color values for converting to grayscale
Returns:grayscale color value [0-255]
shiftContour(contour, x, y)[source]¶

Shifts all the points of the circuit to the specified values x and y

Parameters:
  • contour – contour for shifting
  • x – shift value for horizontal
  • y – shift values for vertical
Returns:

contour with new points
class marktypes.h_mark_processor.HMarkProcessor[source]¶

Contains methods for determining H-mark helipad

checkBoxROIToHMark(image, h_mark_points, binary=False, accept_percentage=85)[source]¶

Check coordinates given by HMarkProcessor.getBoxROI()

Parameters:
  • image – binary image where was found landmark
  • h_mark_points – a array of point from given by HMarkProcessor.getBoxROI()
  • binary – Should be True if image is binary format
  • accept_percentage – accept percentage when landmark will mark as recognized
Returns:
drawMark(img, h_mark_points, shift)[source]¶

Draw mark on image for visual display

Parameters:
  • img – image for drawing
  • h_mark_points – point of mark given by HMarkProcessor.getBoxROI()
  • shift – shift coordinates of mark

Warning

parameter shift is obsolete

Returns:None
drawMarkType(img)[source]¶

Display text with marktype H

Parameters:img – image for drawing
Returns:None
getBoxROI(box)[source]¶

Return interest coordinates of points for recognizing mark

Parameters:box – a array of box given by cv2.boxPoints()
Returns:coordinates of point
